instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power and no green light.

On <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> I only get 12,28V. Is that a normal value for this board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
12.28V means bad communication between SMC and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
If yes, check then <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have 3.412 on  <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and also on  <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

I don't see any corrosion on SMC or <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

Pins 10 and 11 (<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL>/SCL) on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> have 3.4V

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> has 3.22V on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus?

Do you get 12MHZ at Y5010?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Sorry but I can´t find in my schematics where to measure SCL/SDA lines of battery bus. Can you please give a reference component?

Y5010 oscilates  in between 150 and 700 KHz. Ii seams the it gets, for only a breaf moment 12MHz, but it immediately drops again

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
OK, sorry. I was searching something else...

Diode:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> = 0.522
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> = 0.526

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Check signals and voltages for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2), at page 39.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power

threads.message: I don't have any other <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board. I think I know the answer but, can I use an SMC from another board (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
You're right. It was the SMC.
TKS!
